load_images_with_metadata(folder_path, use_subset)[source]

Loads images and their metadata from the specified folder.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – The path to the folder containing the images.

  • use_subset (bool) – Whether to use a random subset of 500 images or full dataset.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the image metadata.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.DataVisualization.PokemonImageVisualization.get_image_data(image_path)[source]

Extracts and returns metadata and statistical information from an image file.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – The file path to the image.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the following keys:

  • ’filename’ (str): The name of the image file.

  • ’width’ (int): The width of the image in pixels.

  • ’height’ (int): The height of the image in pixels.

  • ’mode’ (str): The mode of the image (e.g., ‘RGB’, ‘L’).

  • ’mean_pixel_value’ (float): The mean value of the pixels in the image.

  • ’average_color’ (tuple): The average color of the image as an (R, G, B) tuple.

Return type:

dict

src.DataVisualization.PokemonImageVisualization.parse_filename(filename)[source]

Parses the filename to extract metadata.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the image file.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the following keys:

  • ’index’ (int): The index of the image.

  • ’location’ (str): The location of the image.

  • ’name’ (str): The name of the Pokémon.

  • ’shiny’ (str): The shiny status of the Pokémon.

  • ’gender’ (str): The gender of the Pokémon.

Return type:

dict

src.DataVisualization.PokemonImageVisualization.prompt_subset_choice()[source]

Prompts the user to choose between using a random subset of 500 images or the entire dataset.

Returns:

True if the user chooses to use a random subset, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Opens a dialog to select a folder.

Returns:

The path to the selected folder.
